mechanoreception.notes: As cnidarians, Epizoanthidae likely possess mechanoreceptors to detect physical stimuli in their environment. This is inferred based on its presence in other cnidarians.

chemoreception.notes: As cnidarians, Epizoanthidae likely utilize chemoreception to detect chemical cues in the water, aiding in prey detection and other environmental assessments. This is inferred based on its presence in other cnidarians.

photoreception.notes: The presence of photoreceptors in Epizoanthidae is currently unknown based on the provided context. Further research is needed to determine if they possess any light-sensing capabilities.
